segment.source: Windows Setup Edition Configuration and Product ID Files (EI.cfg and PID.txt)
segment.target: Windows Setup Edition Configuration and Product ID Files (EI.cfg and PID.txt)

segment.source: Windows Setup Edition Configuration and Product ID Files (EI.cfg and PID.txt)
segment.target: Windows Setup Edition Configuration and Product ID Files (EI.cfg and PID.txt)

segment.source: Windows Setup Edition Configuration and Product ID Files (EI.cfg and PID.txt)
segment.target: Windows Setup Edition Configuration and Product ID Files (EI.cfg and PID.txt)

segment.source: The edition configuration (EI.cfg) file and the product ID (PID.txt) file are optional configuration files that you can use to specify the Windows® product key and the Windows edition during Windows installation.
segment.target: The edition configuration (EI.cfg) file and the product ID (PID.txt) file are optional configuration files that you can use to specify the Windows® product key and the Windows edition during Windows installation.

segment.source: You can use these files to automate the product-key entry page in Windows Setup instead of using an answer file.
segment.target: You can use these files to automate the product-key entry page in Windows Setup instead of using an answer file.

segment.source: If you use an EI.cfg file to differentiate volume license media, but you do not include a PID.txt file, the user receives a prompt for a product key to continue Windows Setup.
segment.target: If you use an EI.cfg file to differentiate volume license media, but you do not include a PID.txt file, the user receives a prompt for a product key to continue Windows Setup.

segment.source: You can reuse the product key in the product ID file for multiple installations.
segment.target: You can reuse the product key in the product ID file for multiple installations.

segment.source: The product key in the product ID file is only used to install Windows.
segment.target: The product key in the product ID file is only used to install Windows.

segment.source: This key is not used to activate Windows.
segment.target: This key is not used to activate Windows.

segment.source: For more information, see Work with Product Keys and Activation.
segment.target: For more information, see Work with Product Keys and Activation.

segment.source: Using EI.cfg and PID.txt
segment.target: Using EI.cfg and PID.txt

segment.source: Create these configuration files in a text editor such as Notepad.
segment.target: Create these configuration files in a text editor such as Notepad.

segment.source: Save the files into the folder on the installation media.
segment.target: Save the files into the folder on the installation media.

segment.source: Windows Setup will use these files automatically during installation.
segment.target: Windows Setup will use these files automatically during installation.

segment.source: Run Windows Setup.
segment.target: Run Windows Setup.

segment.source: Setup uses these files during the Windows PE configuration pass as soon as it is launched.
segment.target: Setup uses these files during the Windows PE configuration pass as soon as it is launched.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: An answer file takes precedence over these files.
segment.target: An answer file takes precedence over these files.

segment.source: If you use an answer file during installation, Windows Setup ignores the EI.cfg and PID.txt files.
segment.target: If you use an answer file during installation, Windows Setup ignores the EI.cfg and PID.txt files.

segment.source: EI.cfg Format
segment.target: EI.cfg Format

segment.source: The EI.cfg file specifies the values for the edition ID, the channel, and the volume license.
segment.target: The EI.cfg file specifies the values for the edition ID, the channel, and the volume license.

segment.source: The EI.cfg file has the following format:
segment.target: The EI.cfg file has the following format:

segment.source: {Edition ID} must be a valid Windows edition ID, for example, "Enterprise".
segment.target: {Edition ID} must be a valid Windows edition ID, for example, "Enterprise".

segment.source: To obtain the current EditionID, use the Dism /Get-ImageInfo command or the Dism /Get-CurrentEdition command.
segment.target: To obtain the current EditionID, use the Dism /Get-ImageInfo command or the Dism /Get-CurrentEdition command.

segment.source: For more information, see Take Inventory of an Image or Component Using DISM and DISM Windows Edition-Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see Take Inventory of an Image or Component Using DISM and DISM Windows Edition-Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: {Channel Type} must be either "OEM" or "Retail"
segment.target: {Channel Type} must be either "OEM" or "Retail"

segment.source: {Volume License} must be either 1, if this is a volume license, or 0, if this is not a volume license.
segment.target: {Volume License} must be either 1, if this is a volume license, or 0, if this is not a volume license.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: PID.txt Format
segment.target: PID.txt Format

segment.source: The PID.txt file contains the product key for the edition of Windows that you are installing.
segment.target: The PID.txt file contains the product key for the edition of Windows that you are installing.

segment.source: The PID.txt file has the following format:
segment.target: The PID.txt file has the following format:

segment.source: where XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX is the product key.
segment.target: where XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX is the product key.

segment.source: Troubleshooting
segment.target: Troubleshooting

segment.source: "The product key entered does not match any of the Windows images available for installation. Enter a different product key.": You may need to download a separate version of Windows.
segment.target: "The product key entered does not match any of the Windows images available for installation. Enter a different product key.": You may need to download a separate version of Windows.

segment.source: OEM versions are only available to OEMs, and volume licenses are only available to MSDN subscribers.
segment.target: OEM versions are only available to OEMs, and volume licenses are only available to MSDN subscribers.
